name: The Homer Multitext project on github
tagline: Archival data and software for working with editions of Homeric manuscripts
body:
## Currently published versions##

- [hmt-archive][3]: the project's central data archive.  The master branch is issue `2014-1`.
- [hmt-digital][4]:  digital services for working with the Homer Multitext project archive.  The master branch
is version `1.0`.


## Other current repositories ##

- [hmt-vm][5]:  a virtual machine using Vagrant + Virtual Box for editorial work on the Homer Multitext project
- [hmt-mom][6]: Mandatory On-going Maintenance, a build project for testing and validating editorial
work on the Homer Multitext project
- [hmt-utils][7]:  a JVM library implementing some HMT-specific functionality, such as tokenization of texts
following HMT project conventions
- [morpheus][8]: a fork of the Alpheios modification of the Perseus morphological parser, extending
the morphological data set to cover all vocabulary in the Homer Multitext project archive

## Other work in progress ##

- [hmt-editors-guide][10]:  editorial guide for contributors to the Homer Multitext project (2013 edition currently being updated)
- [hmt-digital-vm][12]:  a virtual machine for hosting the services and applications of `hmt-digital` 


## Other links

- the [Homer Multitext project web site][2]
- the [hmteditors organization on github][11]
- we rely on [the CITE architecture][1]
- from the homermultitext organization on github: [wiki with notes on technical design][9]




[12]: https://github.com/homermultitext/hmt-digital-vm

[11]: http://hmteditors.github.io/

[10]: https://github.com/homermultitext/hmt-editors-guide

[9]: https://github.com/homermultitext/homermultitext.github.io/wiki

[8]: https://github.com/homermultitext/morpheus

[7]: https://github.com/homermultitext/hmt-utils

[6]: https://github.com/homermultitext/hmt-mom

[5]: https://github.com/homermultitext/hmt-vm

[4]: https://github.com/homermultitext/hmt-digital

[3]: https://github.com/homermultitext/hmt-archive

[2]: http://www.homermultitext.org

[1]: http://cite-architecture.github.io/
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
